intro: Agalinis virgata, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky soils, often in disturbed habitats. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Agalinis virgata is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
